Sentencas: In order to understand the exceptional tolerance of ceria to high sulfur levels in the fuel for further SOFC applications, the interaction of sulfur with a commercial Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-x (CGO, from Praxair) and its influence on H-2 production from CH4/H2O mixture was studied.
Titulo: On the promoting effect of H2S on the catalytic H2 production over Gd-doped ceria from CH4/H2O mixtures for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The activity tests were performed at 750 C, in the presence of H2S and under gradual internal reforming conditions (large excess of CH4 with respect to water vapor, 10:1).
Titulo: On the promoting effect of H2S on the catalytic H2 production over Gd-doped ceria from CH4/H2O mixtures for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The presence of H2S in the reactant mixture promoted the catalytic activity of CGO.
Titulo: On the promoting effect of H2S on the catalytic H2 production over Gd-doped ceria from CH4/H2O mixtures for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The nature of various species formed by sulfur-ceria interaction is discussed based on CH4-TPR, XRD, XPS, and in situ FTIR results.
Titulo: On the promoting effect of H2S on the catalytic H2 production over Gd-doped ceria from CH4/H2O mixtures for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: H2S reacts with ceria fraction in CGO and generates new catalytic sites with improved reactivity toward CH4.
Titulo: On the promoting effect of H2S on the catalytic H2 production over Gd-doped ceria from CH4/H2O mixtures for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The formation and stabilization of oxygen vacancies by S-insertion in ceria lattice are evidenced and directly related to the improved activity.
Titulo: On the promoting effect of H2S on the catalytic H2 production over Gd-doped ceria from CH4/H2O mixtures for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The detrimental effect of Ce2O2S phase, when formed, on the catalytic activity of doped ceria is confirmed.
Titulo: On the promoting effect of H2S on the catalytic H2 production over Gd-doped ceria from CH4/H2O mixtures for solid oxide fuel cell applications
